windows.symptom: Issues with activating Windows 10.        Hi, during the free upgrade period I did the update to Win10 from 7.  I didn't realize you had to connect it to my Microsoft account, and I recently had some hardware issues and had to install a new CPU/MB and after Windows repaired itself it's saying I need to activate it.  So, after trouble shooting and trying to re-activate it I cannot.  So, does this mean i'm going to have to spend 139 dollars to re-activate it now?
solutions: Hi Tim. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Linking a Digital License to the account is merely a convenience, you still have the license as long as it still qualifies after a motherboard change. In order to do that it must be premised on a retail license, not factory OEM which comes with preinstalled Windows. When you upgraded the new DL inherits the rights and restrictions of the underlying license.So if it's retail contact Microsoft Support by one of these phone numbers: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/405170...You can also go here: https://partner.support.services.microsoft.com/... choose the link for Browser help, interact briefly about your exact problem, keep replying agent until it connects with an agent.Be aware they may ask for the retail key so I'd try to locate it. There have been reports lately that they're doing this now. But you'd always need the retail key anyway to reinstall the old OS and it hadn't been upgraded.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.
Does this still apply to that mass free upgrade (From Win 7 to Win 10) they had?  Because that's how I got my copy of Windows 10.

The free Upgrade issues a permanent Digital License that lasts for the life of the hardware. But as I wrote above, whether it can more to new hardware depends on if the original Windows install was retail or OEM. If it's retail then it can always change hardware, if it's factory installed or builder's OEM then it cannot.
